edu.cmu.tetrad.data

Class DataReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.tetrad.data.DataReader

  • public final class DataReader
extends Object
    Parses a tabular data file or covariance matrix, with or without data file sectioning, with possibly mixed continuous/discrete variables. With sectioning, a /variables, a /data, and a /knowledge section may be specified. (The /data section is required.) Without sectioning, it is assumed that no variables will be defined in advance and that there will be no knowledge.
    Author:
    Joseph Ramsey

      • parseTabular

        public DataSet parseTabular(File file)
                     throws IOException
        Parses the given files for a tabular data set, returning a RectangularDataSet if successful.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file cannot be read.

      • parseTabular

        public DataSet parseTabular(char[] chars)
        Parses the given character array for a tabular data set, returning a RectangularDataSet if successful. Log messages are written to the LogUtils log; to view them, add System.out to that.

      • parseCovariance

        public ICovarianceMatrix parseCovariance(File file)
                                  throws IOException
        Parses the given files for a tabular data set, returning a RectangularDataSet if successful.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file cannot be read.

      • parseCovariance

        public ICovarianceMatrix parseCovariance(char[] chars)
        Reads in a covariance matrix. The format is as follows. 

         /covariance
 100
 X1   X2   X3   X4
 1.4
 3.2  2.3
 2.5  3.2  5.3
 3.2  2.5  3.2  4.2
 
         CovarianceMatrix dataSet = DataLoader.loadCovMatrix(
                           new FileReader(file), " \t", "//");
        The initial "/covariance" is optional.

      • parseKnowledge

        public IKnowledge parseKnowledge(File file)
                          throws IOException
        Loads knowledge from a file. Assumes knowledge is the only thing in the file. No jokes please. :)
        Throws:
        IOException

      • parseKnowledge

        public IKnowledge parseKnowledge(char[] chars)
        Parses knowledge from the char array, assuming that's all there is in the char array.
